data.title: 准备以至少 30 秒的时间回答以下问题
data.subject: Discuss how you think governments should allocate money.
data.answer: The government should allocate funds properly for appropriate purposes. For example, governments are responsible for social support, legal support, facilities, superannuation, subsidies, and so on. However, a wise and rational decision on the distribution of funds should be allocating the majority of the fund on eliminating the issues affecting residents’ well-being, i.e., concerning people’s livelihood. They need to spend money on private entrepreneur intergenerational succession, food security, the employment market, public transport, and health care. To better approach residents’ increasing expectations and demands on livelihood issues, governments should always treat residents’ needs as the priority and provide an institutional guarantee.
